study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of intralesional cryotherapy versus excision with corticosteroid injections or brachytherapy for treating primary and therapy-resistant keloids.
results_summary: Intralesional cryotherapy was inferior to excision followed by brachytherapy for resistant keloids, showing no significant improvement in scar appearance or symptoms. For primary keloids, cryotherapy reduced volume but did not improve appearance, while surgery showed better results.
population_specificity: Patients with primary keloids and therapy-resistant keloids.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the indications, contraindications, and complications of endobronchial ablative therapies, including cryotherapy, for treating malignant and benign airway lesions.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that cryotherapy is one of several endobronchial ablative therapies used to improve symptoms, quality of life, and survival in patients with airway lesions, but specific results for cryotherapy alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with symptomatic malignant and benign airway lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of cryosurgery in excising a giant recurrent sacral chordoma and assess its potential to improve radiotherapy efficacy in local tumor control.
results_summary: Cryosurgery was used for intralesional excision of a large recurrent sacral chordoma when wide or marginal excision was not feasible. The study suggests cryosurgery may enhance radiotherapy efficacy in local tumor control, particularly for gelatinous tumors with high contamination risk.
population_specificity: A 64-year-old female with a locally recurrent sacral chordoma after ten prior interventions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of intracanal, intraoral, and extraoral cryotherapy on postoperative pain in molar teeth with symptomatic apical periodontitis.
results_summary: All cryotherapy groups (intracanal, intraoral, and extraoral) showed significantly lower postoperative pain and percussion pain compared to the control group at all measured time points (days 1, 3, 5, and 7). The group variable had the most significant effect on postoperative pain at day 1.
population_specificity: 100 patients with molar teeth exhibiting symptomatic apical periodontitis.
study_duration: Pain was assessed up to 7 days post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness, safety, and practicality of cryotherapy as a treatment for cervical premalignant lesions (CIN) in low-resource settings.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is effective, simple, and safe for treating CIN, with a slightly lower cure rate for high-grade lesions compared to excisional methods. It is recommended in low-resource settings due to its low complication rate and cost-effectiveness.
population_specificity: Women with cervical premalignant lesions (CIN) in low-resource settings.

study_goal: The researchers were discussing emerging unconventional therapies, including cryotherapy, for alopecia areata in the absence of approved treatments.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about cryotherapy's effects, only mentioning it as an emerging unconventional therapy for alopecia areata.
population_specificity: Patients with alopecia areata seeking unconventional treatments.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of whole gland and focal cryotherapy on erectile function recovery in men with localized prostate cancer.
results_summary: Whole gland cryotherapy significantly reduced erectile function at 6 months with minimal improvement by 36 months, while focal cryotherapy showed minimal or no effect on erectile function, though the latter involved smaller disease foci.
population_specificity: Men with localized prostate cancer treated with primary ablative therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a local treatment option for Kaposi's Sarcoma (KS) in patients with limited skin lesions.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as a commonly used physical treatment for KS, but no specific outcomes or efficacy data are provided regarding its effects. It is grouped with other local treatments without detailed results.
population_specificity: HIV-infected patients with Kaposi's Sarcoma (KS) and limited skin lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare postprocedural pain between liquid nitrogen spray cryotherapy (LNC) and radiofrequency ablation (RFA) in patients with dysplastic Barrett's esophagus.
results_summary: LNC was associated with significantly less postprocedural pain compared to RFA, both immediately after treatment and at 48 hours, with no difference in dysphagia between the groups. The odds of pain after RFA were at least 5 times greater than after LNC.
population_specificity: Patients with dysplastic Barrett's esophagus (94 total: 35 LNC, 59 RFA).
study_duration: Pain assessed immediately posttreatment, 48 hours posttreatment, and at 3 weeks posttreatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficiency and safety of a new cryotherapy device (cTreatment®) compared to a standard cold therapy regimen in patients undergoing unilateral, primary total knee arthroplasty (TKA).
results_summary: The new cryotherapy device showed statistically significant benefits in range of motion (ROM) on the sixth post-operative day and reduced pain intensity on the second post-operative day compared to standard cold therapy. No significant differences were found in pain at rest, PCA consumption, or knee girth, and no adverse effects were observed in either group.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing unilateral, primary total knee arthroplasty (TKA).
effective_dosage: Cold pack application for six days post-surgery (standard group); cTreatment® protocol details not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of anti-VEGF drugs, either as monotherapy or in combination with cryotherapy/laser therapy, for treating retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) in preterm infants.
results_summary: The study found that intravitreal pegaptanib combined with laser therapy reduced the risk of retinal detachment and ROP recurrence compared to laser/cryotherapy alone, but the quality of evidence was low. Cryotherapy's standalone efficacy or safety was not directly assessed.
population_specificity: Preterm infants with type 1 ROP (zone I or II with specific stages and plus disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a 10-minute ice-pack application effectively relieved postpartum perineal pain and if the analgesic effect lasted up to 2 hours.
results_summary: The study found that a 10-minute ice-pack application significantly reduced perineal pain immediately post-intervention, but the effect was not maintained beyond 1h 45min to 2h, with pain levels eventually increasing similarly in both groups.
population_specificity: 69 primiparous women aged ≥18, 6-24h postpartum, with perineal pain ≥3 and no recent anti-inflammatory or analgesic use.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the noninferiority of a novel, individualized cryotherapy-dosing strategy versus a conventional approach for cryoballoon ablation of pulmonary veins in patients with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in atrial fibrillation recurrence rates between the conventional and individualized dosing strategies at 1-year follow-up (79.4% vs. 78.3%). The new protocol resulted in shorter cryotherapy and procedure times with equal safety and similar outcomes.
population_specificity: 140 patients with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation refractory to antiarrhythmic drugs.
effective_dosage: Conventional strategy: 180-second cryoballoon applications per vein with a bonus freeze; study group: time-to-effect-based application (electric block time plus 60- and 120-second freeze bonus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the current evidence and clinical practices regarding interventional bronchoscopy techniques, including cryotherapy, in pediatric patients.
results_summary: The study highlighted a scarcity of published evidence on cryotherapy in pediatric airway endoscopy, relying on collective clinical experience due to insufficient data.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with airway disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the therapeutic effects of a bleomycin microneedle patch with cryotherapy in treating warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed comparable efficacy to the bleomycin microneedle patch in reducing wart size and achieving similar PGA and PaGA scores, but was significantly more painful according to patient reports.
population_specificity: 42 patients with more than two wart lesions.
study_duration: Effects assessed at weeks 8 and 16 after initial treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a focal therapy option for prostate cancer, focusing on its potential to minimize side effects compared to radical treatments.
results_summary: The study highlights cryotherapy as a promising focal therapy for prostate cancer, offering effective treatment with fewer risks of incontinence and impotence compared to radical approaches. Outcomes data suggest it is a viable option among other directed energy therapies like HIFU and laser ablation.
population_specificity: Men with prostate cancer

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a salvage therapy option for patients with biochemical recurrence (BCR) of prostate cancer after primary radiotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several salvage therapy options for BCR after primary radiotherapy, but no specific efficacy data or comparative outcomes are provided. The study emphasizes the need for individualized treatment decisions.
population_specificity: Patients with biochemical recurrence of prostate cancer following primary radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare patient-reported quality of life (urinary, bowel, and sexual function) between Cryotherapy, CyberKnife, and active holistic surveillance in prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy initially showed lower but non-significant bowel function scores and significantly lower sexual function scores compared to AHS, but both improved over time, matching AHS levels by the third year. Hormonal therapy history was associated with lower sexual function scores in Cryotherapy patients.
population_specificity: Patients with organ-confined prostate cancer treated with Cryotherapy, CyberKnife, or active holistic surveillance.

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the potential of minimally invasive therapies, particularly high-intensity focused ultrasound, as a treatment option for locally advanced unresectable pancreatic cancer.
results_summary: The study suggests that minimally invasive therapies, including high-intensity focused ultrasound, show promising results for treating unresectable pancreatic cancer, though clinical applications are still in early stages.
population_specificity: Patients with locally advanced unresectable pancreatic cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cryotherapy with other treatment modalities for seborrheic keratosis removal and evaluate patient preferences and side effects.
results_summary: The study highlights cryotherapy as the most commonly used method for seborrheic keratosis removal but also discusses alternative treatments like topical keratolytics, vitamin D analogues, and lasers, noting varying efficacy and potential side effects.
population_specificity: Middle-aged and elderly adults with seborrheic keratosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy, as an adjunct treatment, could lower the recurrence rate of odontogenic keratocysts (OKCs) compared to enucleation alone.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy significantly reduced the recurrence rate of OKCs (P = .013) compared to enucleation alone. However, fragmentation of the cystic capsule did not influence recurrence rates.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with odontogenic keratocysts (OKCs) between 1991 and 2013, including those with and without nevoid basal cell carcinoma syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of bevacizumab compared to PRP/cryotherapy and observation in reducing enucleation rates and controlling intraocular pressure in neovascular glaucoma following proton beam therapy for uveal melanoma.
results_summary: The PRP/cryotherapy subgroup showed a better eye retention rate compared to the observation subgroup, though statistical significance was not reached (p=0.15). Cryotherapy's efficacy was not directly compared to bevacizumab in isolation.
population_specificity: Patients with rubeosis following proton therapy for uveal melanoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) and cold water immersion (CWI) on recovery markers after a marathon, assessing muscle function, soreness, and blood parameters.
results_summary: WBC negatively impacted muscle function compared to CWI and showed no significant benefits over placebo for inflammation or muscle damage markers, except for slightly reducing perceived training stress. Cryotherapy was no more effective than placebo for functional recovery or stress perception.
population_specificity: Thirty-one endurance-trained males who completed a marathon.
study_duration: Assessments were made at baseline, post-intervention, and 24 and 48 hours post-marathon.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical efficacy and safety of thermotherapy versus cryotherapy in treating skin warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a 58.3% clearance rate, lower than thermotherapy (79.2%), though the difference was not statistically significant. Minimal post-treatment complications were reported, but scarring was noted in 20% of thermotherapy cases.
population_specificity: 52 patients aged 18+ with ≤10 skin warts.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy every 2-3 weeks for up to six sessions if required.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare oncologic outcomes of cryotherapy with other definitive treatments (surgery, radiation, androgen deprivation therapy) in low- and intermediate-risk prostate cancer patients after active surveillance.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used in 11% of patients who underwent definitive treatment after active surveillance. The study did not specifically highlight cryotherapy's outcomes but noted radiation therapy had worse biochemical recurrence and overall mortality compared to other treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) low- and intermediate-risk prostate cancer diagnosed from 1990 to 2012 who did not undergo immediate definitive treatment within 12 months of diagnosis.
study_duration: Median follow-up was 71.7 months after a median time on active surveillance of 63.4 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of whole body cryotherapy (WBC) on recovery after exercise by analyzing existing literature.
results_summary: WBC reduced muscle pain in 80% of studies, improved athletic capacity and performance in 71% of controlled exercise studies, and lowered markers of inflammation and muscle damage. Multiple exposures showed more consistent benefits.
population_specificity: Healthy, physically active subjects.
effective_dosage: Exposure to temperatures between -110 to -190°C (specific duration and frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare physiological responses and recovery effects between cold-water immersion (CWI) and partial-body cryotherapy (PBC) following a muscle-damaging protocol.
results_summary: The study compared CWI (10°C for 10 minutes) and PBC (-60°C for 30 seconds, -135°C for 2 minutes) but did not provide conclusive results in the abstract. Physiological variables like thigh muscle oxygen saturation were measured, but full findings were not detailed.
population_specificity: 19 healthy males
effective_dosage: CWI: 10°C for 10 minutes; PBC: -60°C for 30 seconds, -135°C for 2 minutes
study_duration: Single session (CWI: 10 minutes; PBC: 2.5 minutes total)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of continuous-flow cryocompression therapy (CFCT) in reducing pain and postoperative blood loss during the acute recovery phase after hip fracture surgery.
results_summary: CFCT showed a mild analgesic effect at 72 hours but no significant differences in analgesic use, transfusion incidence, functional outcomes, or complications compared to usual care. Patient satisfaction with CFCT was moderate (7.1/10).
population_specificity: Patients with intra- or extracapsular hip fractures scheduled for surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Spray Cryotherapy (SCT) on healing management in patients with nasal polyposis who underwent functional endoscopic sinus surgery.
results_summary: Postoperative Lund-Mackay and SNOT-22 scores significantly decreased in both groups, with lower scores in the cryotherapy group compared to placebo. No serious side effects were reported in either group.
population_specificity: 40 patients with nasal polyposis requiring functional endoscopic sinus surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the spectrum of endometrial ablation techniques, including cryotherapy, and compare their clinical outcomes and adverse events to hysterectomy and medical therapies.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that cryotherapy-based nonresectoscopic endometrial ablation (NREA) techniques were published in the early and mid-20th century, but it does not provide specific results regarding its effects.
population_specificity: Women with heavy menstrual bleeding (HMB) secondary to endometrial or ovulatory disorders who no longer desire future fertility.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if controlled irrigation with cold saline could reduce postoperative pain incidence and intensity in patients with pulp necrosis and symptomatic apical periodontitis.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy significantly reduced postoperative pain incidence, intensity, and the need for medication compared to the control group using room temperature saline.
population_specificity: 210 patients with necrotic uniradicular teeth and symptomatic apical periodontitis (preoperative VAS score >7).
effective_dosage: 20 mL sterile cold (2.5°C) saline solution delivered for 5 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy and adverse reactions of cryotherapy combined with interferon in treating chronic cervicitis complicated with HPV infection.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy combined with interferon significantly reduced HPV load, improved clinical efficacy, and shortened recovery times compared to the control group, with no serious adverse reactions reported.
population_specificity: 100 cases of chronic cervicitis complicated with HPV infection, divided into observation (50) and control (50) groups.
study_duration: Treatment duration not explicitly stated; follow-up at 3 months post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of different cryotherapy methods (salted ice bag, GameReady, and PowerPlay-ice bag) in reducing muscle and skin temperatures.
results_summary: All three cryotherapy methods produced equivalent intramuscular temperature decreases, with no significant differences between treatments. Skin cooling also showed no significant differences among the methods.
population_specificity: Twelve healthy college-aged participants (4 males, 8 females) without compromised circulation or injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinicodemographic profile and treatment outcomes of ocular surface squamous neoplasia (OSSN), including the use of cryotherapy as part of the treatment regimen.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used in combination with wide local excision (4 mm margin clearance) in seven cases, contributing to an overall complete regression rate of 88% in OSSN cases. Recurrence occurred in three cases, but these were managed with more aggressive treatments.
population_specificity: 57 eyes (56 cases) with clinically diagnosed OSSN, predominantly older adults (median age 55 years) with a male predominance (4.5:1 ratio).
effective_dosage: Not specified (used as adjunct to surgical excision).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pre-emptive cryotherapy (ice application) could reduce perceived pain from subcutaneous local anesthetic injections in patients with simple lacerations.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced perceived pain during anesthetic injections (median pain score 2.0 vs. 5.0 in controls, p=0.001) with no reported complications. The pain from cryotherapy itself was minimal (median score 2.0).
population_specificity: Patients with simple lacerations needing primary repair in an emergency center.
effective_dosage: 1.5×1.5×1.5 cm ice cube applied for 2 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore whether combining immune therapies with thermal therapies like cryotherapy could enhance tumor response rates.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that cryotherapy, along with other thermal therapies, improves immune responses pre-clinically, but clinical testing is needed to determine optimal timing and combinations for enhancing tumor response.
population_specificity: Not specified (pre-clinical focus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential role of local cryotherapy (LC) in managing acute hemophilic hemarthrosis (AHH) and address the controversy surrounding its use.
results_summary: Some studies suggest LC reduces joint inflammation and controls swelling and temperature, while others indicate it may impair coagulation enzyme activity and platelet function. The data on LC's role in AHH remains limited and conflicting.
population_specificity: Patients with acute hemophilic hemarthrosis (AHH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of topical J. excelsa extract as an adjuvant to cryotherapy for treating cutaneous leishmaniasis.
results_summary: The study found that adding J. excelsa extract to cryotherapy significantly increased complete cure rates (82% vs. 34%) and reduced healing time compared to cryotherapy alone. No significant side effects were reported except mild local irritation in a few patients.
population_specificity: 72 patients with clinical diagnosis of cutaneous leishmaniasis confirmed by leishmania smears.
effective_dosage: Not specified (topical formulation of J. excelsa extract applied for 3 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy in managing acute hemarthroses pain in hemophilic patients as part of a multimodal treatment approach.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was included as a recommended component for acute hemarthroses pain management, alongside hematologic treatment, joint rest, and analgesics, but no specific efficacy data or comparative analysis was provided.
population_specificity: Hemophilic patients with acute hemarthroses (joint bleeds).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy reduces the progression of cervical low-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions (LSIL) to high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions (HSIL) in HIV-infected women.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced progression to HSIL by 86% overall and 87% in hrHPV-positive women, with improved regression to normal histology and cytologic outcomes compared to no treatment.
population_specificity: HIV-infected women with histologic cervical LSIL in Johannesburg, South Africa.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of intralesional antimony (IL-Sbv) combined with cryotherapy versus IL-Sbv alone for treating cutaneous leishmaniasis.
results_summary: The study found that IL-Sbv combined with cryotherapy had a higher efficacy rate (81.8%) compared to IL-Sbv alone (53.3%), with a statistically significant difference (OR: 3.14, p = 0.03). No significant difference in efficacy was observed between cryotherapy and other local therapies like topical paromomycin or hypertonic saline.
population_specificity: Patients with cutaneous leishmaniasis (5679 patients across 40 studies, with a subset directly comparing IL-Sbv and cryotherapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a salvage treatment for isolated local relapse after prostate cancer radiotherapy, comparing its safety and efficacy to other strategies like surgery, HIFU, and reirradiation.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that cryotherapy has shown interesting results in limited series, but the risk of urinary and rectal toxicity is high. Newer technologies may reduce complication rates, but data is insufficient for firm conclusions.
population_specificity: Patients with isolated local relapse after prostate cancer radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether interferential current (IFC) therapy, combined with cryotherapy, NSAIDs, and exercise, provided additional benefits for treating subacromial impingement syndrome (SAIS).
results_summary: Cryotherapy, when combined with NSAIDs and exercise, showed statistically significant improvements in pain and function for SAIS patients, but adding IFC therapy did not provide additional benefits. Both groups (active IFC and sham IFC) showed similar outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients aged 25-65 with a clinical diagnosis of SAIS (N.=65, with 60 completing the study).
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy (used alongside NSAIDs and exercise).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review available treatment methods for molluscum contagiosum, including cryotherapy, to aid dermatologists in therapy selection.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about cryotherapy's effects, only mentioning it as one of several reviewed treatment options.
population_specificity: Children and immunocompromised individuals with molluscum contagiosum.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of manual lymphatic drainage (MLD) combined with cryotherapy on facial edema and pain in patients post-orthognathic surgery.
results_summary: Cryotherapy, when combined with MLD, showed faster and greater regression of swelling compared to placebo, but no significant difference in pain relief or edema perception was found between groups.
population_specificity: 30 patients who underwent bimaxillary orthognathic surgery.
study_duration: From the 2nd postoperative day (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether elevation during cryotherapy affects intramuscular temperature changes when combined with ice and compression.
results_summary: The study found that treatments involving ice (alone or combined with compression/elevation) significantly cooled intramuscular temperatures compared to non-ice treatments. Elevation did not influence temperature changes during cryotherapy.
population_specificity: 15 healthy volunteers (mean age 20.93 years).
effective_dosage: Not specified (conditions included ice, compression, and elevation in various combinations).

study_goal: To determine if wearing lower-body garments with cooled phase change material (PCM) enhances recovery after a soccer match.
results_summary: PCM cooling garments improved maximal isometric voluntary contraction (MIVC) at 36 hours postmatch and accelerated recovery in elite soccer players.
population_specificity: 11 elite soccer players from the reserve squad of a team in the second-highest league in England.
effective_dosage: PCM cooled to 15°C (specific frequency not mentioned).
study_duration: Not specified (postmatch recovery period assessed up to 36 hours).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cryotherapy with other ablation techniques (like RFA and microwaves) for treating lung tumors, focusing on indications, results, and complications.
results_summary: Cryotherapy, along with other ablation techniques, showed excellent tolerance with very few complications and could overcome some limitations of RFA, particularly for tumors <3cm in diameter. Future potential associations with immunotherapy were also discussed.
population_specificity: Patients with early-stage non-small cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC) not amenable to surgery and those with slow-evolving localized metastatic disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Cryotherapy as an endoscopic technique for treating Barrett's esophagus (BE) and high-grade dysplasia.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed promise with a good efficacy and safety profile, though it is not yet mainstream due to the need for more studies. It was noted as a less invasive alternative to surgical esophagectomy.
population_specificity: Patients with T1a esophageal adenocarcinoma and BE of high-grade dysplasia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in reducing postoperative pain and opioid consumption after total knee arthroplasty.
results_summary: Very low-certainty evidence suggested cryotherapy was associated with a slight reduction in opioid consumption and modest pain improvement, though the effects were not robust. The study noted significant heterogeneity (I² = 86% for opioid consumption, I² = 62% for pain).
population_specificity: Patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty (2391 patients across 39 randomized clinical trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of adjuvant cryotherapy in treating a cellular blue nevus of the conjunctiva that resembled melanoma.
results_summary: The study found that excisional biopsy combined with cryotherapy resulted in no recurrence over an eight-year follow-up, suggesting effective treatment. The histopathology confirmed the diagnosis and supported the use of cryotherapy as part of the treatment regimen.
population_specificity: A 29-year-old Chinese male with a congenital giant pigmented conjunctival lesion.
study_duration: Not specified (single intervention with long-term follow-up)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cryotherapy methods (no cryotherapy vs. cryotherapy, cold packs vs. continuous flow devices) and their protocols, as well as conduct a cost-benefit analysis for patients undergoing UKA or TKA.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed favorable outcomes in 5 out of 8 studies, with continuous flow devices preferred in 3 out of 6 comparisons. No significant differences were found in pain, opioid use, or drain output between different temperature settings of continuous flow devices.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent unicompartmental knee arthroplasty (UKA) or total knee arthroplasty (TKA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy among various therapeutic modalities in the rehabilitation of orthopaedic injuries.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that cryotherapy is one of several effective modalities used in rehabilitation, but it should be adjunctive to standard exercise and manual therapy. The efficacy of cryotherapy depends on the specific phase of rehabilitation.
population_specificity: Orthopaedic injury patients (surgical and nonsurgical)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of liquid nitrogen cryotherapy (LNC) for eradicating Barrett's esophagus (BE) dysplasia after endoscopic mucosal resection (EMR) of intramucosal cancer (IMCA) and to assess progression to invasive disease.
results_summary: The study found that 82% of patients achieved complete eradication of dysplasia, and 70% achieved complete eradication of intestinal metaplasia. Only 4% of patients developed invasive cancer during follow-up.
population_specificity: Patients with Barrett's esophagus who underwent endoscopic mucosal resection for intramucosal cancer.
study_duration: At least 1 year follow-up from initial LNC

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of office-based cryosurgical ablation of the posterior nasal nerve (PNN) for treating chronic rhinitis.
results_summary: The procedure was successfully completed in all patients with no complications, significantly reducing Total Nasal Symptom Scores (TNSS) at 30, 90, 180, and 365 days post-treatment. Both allergic and nonallergic subcohorts showed significant symptom improvement.
population_specificity: 27 patients with chronic rhinorrhea and/or nasal congestion for >3 months (allergic or nonallergic rhinitis).
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryotherapy applied bilaterally to the PNN region).
study_duration: Single intervention with follow-ups at 7, 30, 90, 180, and 365 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the oncologic and functional outcomes of partial gland ablation (including cryotherapy) versus robot-assisted radical prostatectomy in patients with low and intermediate-risk prostate cancer.
results_summary: Cryotherapy had a partial gland ablation failure rate of 31.2%, higher than the overall salvage treatment risk associated with partial gland ablation. Functional outcomes like potency and continence were better preserved with partial gland ablation compared to radical prostatectomy.
population_specificity: Patients with Gleason score 3 + 3 or 3 + 4, clinical stage T2b or less, prostate-specific antigen ≤15 ng/dl, unilateral disease, and life expectancy >10 years.
study_duration: Mean follow-up was 38.44 months for the partial gland ablation group.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of a portable cryotherapy system (CbFAS) for treating early esophageal squamous cell neoplasia (ESCN).
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy successfully eradicated ESCN in all patients, with no major adverse events reported; mild chest pain and strictures were manageable, and all patients remained disease-free during follow-up.
population_specificity: Patients with early ESCN (low-grade intraepithelial neoplasia, high-grade intraepithelial neoplasia, or early T1 squamous mucosal cancer).
effective_dosage: 8, 10, or 12 seconds of ice per site, repeated until biopsy confirmed eradication.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of different cold treatments (whole-body cryotherapy at -110°C, -60°C, and local cryotherapy) on the antioxidative capacity of patients with active rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: Whole-body cryotherapy at -110°C induced a short-term increase in total peroxyl radical trapping antioxidant capacity (TRAP) during the first session, but no significant changes were observed within treatment groups over the week. The effect was transient, and cold treatments did not cause significant oxidative stress or adaptation.
population_specificity: 60 patients with active rheumatoid arthritis.
effective_dosage: Three treatments daily for 7 consecutive days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate randomized controlled trials assessing the use of cryotherapy after arthroscopic debridement and anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was noted to decrease pain, swelling, and inflammation post-surgery, but no definitive devices or modalities were identified. The review highlights the need for further research to establish standardized cryotherapy protocols.
population_specificity: Postoperative patients following arthroscopic knee debridement and anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature on the dermatological use of laser therapy in the treatment of skin cancer, comparing it to other interventions like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy, focusing instead on laser therapy for skin cancers such as melanoma, basal cell carcinoma, and squamous cell carcinoma.
population_specificity: Not specified for cryotherapy (study focused on skin cancer patients in general).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and feasibility of cryotherapy and thermal coagulation as ablative treatments for precancerous cervical lesions, particularly in low-resource settings.
results_summary: Cryotherapy and thermal coagulation successfully eradicated 75%-85% of high-grade cervical lesions with minor adverse effects. New cryotherapy devices without external gas supply and portable thermal coagulation devices show promise for wider implementation in low-resource settings.
population_specificity: Women with precancerous cervical lesions, particularly in low-resource settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the oncologic outcomes and toxicity rates of salvage cryotherapy (SCT) with other salvage treatments for radiorecurrent prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that minimally invasive salvage approaches, including SCT, showed comparable overall survival to more invasive treatments like salvage radical prostatectomy, with a trend toward lower morbidity rates. SCT appears to be a durable option for salvage treatment in radiorecurrent prostate cancer.
population_specificity: Patients with radiorecurrent prostate cancer after primary radiation treatment failure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of cryotherapy versus other treatments for anogenital warts (AGWs).
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed similar efficacy to trichloroacetic acid, podophyllin, and imiquimod but was less effective than electrosurgery. It was associated with more immediate low-level adverse events (e.g., erythema, stinging, pain) but fewer erosions.
population_specificity: Immunocompetent adults with anogenital warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the oncologic and functional outcomes of prostate cryotherapy in low-risk prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found a 15.4% biochemical failure rate, significant post-operative erectile dysfunction (65% severe at 1 month, improving to 47.2% at 3 months), and low urinary incontinence rates (4.8% at 3 months, dropping to 2.9% at 6 months). Cryotherapy was concluded as a viable alternative for low-risk prostate cancer.
population_specificity: 434 patients with low-risk prostate cancer (D'Amico's risk classification), median age 66 years.
effective_dosage: Two cycles of freezing/thawing per patient (Onik technique).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate current and emerging technologies for prostate cancer focal therapy, including ablation techniques like cryotherapy, to improve oncological control while preserving function.
results_summary: The abstract summarizes advances in imaging, biopsy, biomarkers, and ablative technologies for focal therapy but does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy's effects. It highlights the need for further study to establish safety and efficacy parameters for these technologies.
population_specificity: Men with prostate cancer eligible for focal therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether morphological wart characteristics and HPV type influence the treatment response of cryotherapy alone or combined with salicylic acid.
results_summary: Cryotherapy alone was less effective for warts with callus or deeper skin penetration, but HPV type did not affect its efficacy. Combined cryotherapy and salicylic acid showed reduced effectiveness for warts with HPV types from the alpha genus (HPV2, HPV27, or HPV57).
population_specificity: Patients with cutaneous warts (common and plantar warts).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as part of the multimodal treatment for retinoblastoma, focusing on preserving life, eye, and optimizing residual vision.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is mentioned as one of the focal treatments for retinoblastoma, contributing to the multimodal approach alongside chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and surgery. The abstract does not provide specific outcomes or comparative efficacy data for cryotherapy alone.
population_specificity: Children with retinoblastoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of biofield therapy compared to sham therapy for treating refractory warts, not Cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not report results for Cryotherapy, as the study focuses on biofield therapy.
population_specificity: Subjects with warts on their feet or hands.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of arterio-venous foot pumps (AVFP) compared to other swelling reduction methods, including cryotherapy, in patients with ankle fractures.
results_summary: AVFP devices showed statistically significant reductions in swelling and shorter time to surgery compared to controls (leg elevation and cryotherapy), but evidence strength was deemed poor. Cryotherapy (continuous and cool pack) was less effective than AVFP in reducing swelling.
population_specificity: Patients with ankle fractures requiring operative fixation.
study_duration: Measurements taken at 24 and 48 hours post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy versus brachytherapy in treating low- to intermediate-risk prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was inferior to brachytherapy, with a 5-year biochemical progression-free survival rate of 57.9% for cryotherapy versus 89.6% for brachytherapy. Cryotherapy showed significantly lower efficacy in both low- and intermediate-risk groups.
population_specificity: Patients with low- to intermediate-risk prostate cancer treated between 1990 and 2012.
effective_dosage: Median of 2 freeze-thaw cycles (range, 2-4 cycles), with a mean nadir temperature of -35°C.
study_duration: Median follow-up periods ranged from 59.2 to 85.6 months across groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in reducing inflammatory complications after third molar removal.
results_summary: The study found that the benefits of cryotherapy are yet to be established, indicating insufficient evidence to support its efficacy in managing postoperative complications.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing third molar (wisdom tooth) removal.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review emerging multimodality treatment approaches, including cryotherapy, for managing advanced-stage breast cancer metastasis.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that cryotherapy is among the emerging avenues for managing advanced-stage breast cancer metastasis, with some single-institution reports showing improved survival in selected patients, such as those with oligometastatic stage IV breast cancer. However, specific efficacy data for cryotherapy alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced-stage breast cancer, particularly those with oligometastatic stage IV.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review treatment options for molluscum contagiosum, with a focus on cryotherapy as a preferred method for lesion destruction.
results_summary: Cryotherapy with liquid nitrogen was identified as a method of choice for treating molluscum contagiosum, particularly for physical destruction of lesions, alongside chemical destruction with cantharidin. The abstract highlights cryotherapy's effectiveness but does not provide specific efficacy data.
population_specificity: Preschool and elementary school-aged children affected by molluscum contagiosum.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review existing reports on various treatments, including cryotherapy, for Orf virus infection without specific controlled clinical trial evidence.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several reported successful treatments for Orf virus infection, but no controlled clinical trials support its efficacy.
population_specificity: Humans handling sheep and goats, infected with Orf virus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy combined with intravitreal ranibizumab and laser coagulation in treating stage 3 Coats' disease with exudative retinal detachment.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, when used with other treatments, led to subretinal fluid absorption and retinal reattachment in all patients, with no reported complications. Visual acuity improved or remained unchanged in most cases.
population_specificity: Seventeen patients (88.24% male, 11.76% female) with stage 3 Coats' disease.
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy alone; treatments were administered 1 to 5 times per patient (average 2.82 ± 0.95 times).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential role of cryotherapy as a salvage treatment option for biochemical recurrent prostate cancer in carefully selected patients.
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryotherapy may be considered for biochemical recurrent prostate cancer in very narrow patient criteria, but its efficacy and safety are based on non-randomized trials without detailed outcomes. No specific results on cryotherapy's success rates or adverse effects are provided.
population_specificity: Men with biochemical recurrent prostate cancer meeting narrow selection criteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the surgical, oncological, and functional outcomes of laparoscopic and percutaneous cryoablation for treating small renal masses.
results_summary: The study found that both laparoscopic and percutaneous cryoablation offer similar favorable oncological outcomes with minimal effect on renal function. Percutaneous cryoablation was associated with shorter hospital stays, while laparoscopy showed a lower likelihood of residual disease, though tumor recurrence rates favored percutaneous cryoablation.
population_specificity: Patients with small renal masses (1725 cases: 804 percutaneous and 921 laparoscopic cryoablations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cooling effectiveness of PowerPlay with frozen gel packs (PP-gel) versus wetted ice bags (PP-ice) and a control (no treatment) on skin and intramuscular temperature.
results_summary: PP-ice produced significantly greater muscle and skin cooling compared to PP-gel and the control, with clinically and statistically meaningful differences.
population_specificity: Twelve healthy college-aged participants (4 men, 8 women; mean age 23.08 years).
effective_dosage: PowerPlay applied at 70 mm Hg for 30 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of thermal ablative techniques, including cryotherapy, as treatment options for small renal masses in patients not eligible for surgery, and to discuss post-treatment surveillance and salvage therapy.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that thermal ablation is a viable option for small renal masses in non-surgical candidates, though its oncologic efficacy has not been directly compared to nephron-sparing surgery in randomized trials. Post-ablation surveillance may be necessary for tumor recurrence, and salvage therapy often involves repeating the same ablative modality or surgery, which can be complicated by prior ablation.
population_specificity: Patients with small renal masses who are not candidates for surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic efficacy and safety of cryotherapy compared to other topical treatments for leishmaniasis.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a moderate cure rate, lower than other treatments reviewed, which had cure rates over 80%. Adverse effects were common but generally mild, including redness, pain, and pigmentation changes.
population_specificity: Patients aged 4-85 years with leishmaniasis, primarily caused by L. tropica and L. major.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of cryotherapy (CT) with other treatments for non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) through a network meta-analysis.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in cumulative recurrence probabilities (CRP) for cryotherapy compared to other treatments. Cryotherapy was not highlighted as a top-performing treatment in efficacy rankings (CLR, CLC) but also did not show significant adverse effects compared to the vehicle (VE).
population_specificity: 3706 patients with non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of cryotherapy versus loop electrosurgical excision procedure for treating high-grade cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (grade ≥2) in HIV-seropositive women.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed higher cumulative incidence of cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade ≥2 at 6 months compared to loop electrosurgical excision procedure, but the difference was not significant by 12 months. Both treatments reduced cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade ≥2 by >70% at 12 months, though recurrence rates were relatively high in both groups.
population_specificity: HIV-seropositive women aged 18-65 with histology-proven cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade ≥2.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of cryotherapy in preventing mucositis in children undergoing chemotherapy or stem cell transplant conditioning regimens.
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryotherapy may be beneficial for preventing mucositis in cooperative children undergoing high-risk treatments, though specific efficacy data is not detailed.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents receiving cytotoxic cancer therapy or hematopoietic stem cell transplant conditioning.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of cryotherapy as a depigmentation therapy for vitiligo patients unresponsive to repigmentation treatments.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that cryotherapy, along with other physical modalities, is being used successfully for depigmentation in vitiligo patients. However, specific efficacy data or outcomes for cryotherapy alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with vitiligo affecting extensive body surface areas who are unresponsive to repigmentation therapies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the outcomes of surgical resection versus bronchoscopic resection (including cryotherapy) for treating symptomatic endobronchial hamartoma in surgically fit patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy, as part of bronchoscopic treatment, showed variable complete resection rates (50-100%) and required repeated sessions for some patients. Recurrence rates ranged from 0% to 50%, with pneumothorax being the most common complication.
population_specificity: Surgically fit patients with biopsy-proven symptomatic endobronchial hamartoma.
study_duration: Follow-up periods varied, with some studies reporting up to 60 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the cost-effectiveness and efficacy of cryotherapy for postoperative rehabilitation in patients undergoing rotator cuff repair.
results_summary: Two studies showed improved patient outcomes with cryotherapy, while two found no immediate temperature decrease but a delayed effect. One study suggested simple cryotherapy methods (ice bag and Ace bandage) may be as effective as continuous cryotherapy units.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing rotator cuff repair.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy, safety, cosmetic outcome, patient satisfaction, and cost-effectiveness of pulsed CO2 laser, cryotherapy, and surgery for treating superficial basal cell carcinoma (sBCC).
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed no statistically significant difference in efficacy, cosmetic outcome, or patient satisfaction compared to pulsed CO2 laser. However, surgery had the highest efficacy rate, and CO2 laser resulted in shorter wound healing times.
population_specificity: Patients with basal cell carcinomas (BCCs) of the trunk and extremities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility and safety of liquid nitrogen cryospray ablation for achieving complete eradication of dysplasia (CE-D) and intestinal metaplasia (CE-IM) in patients with dysplastic Barrett's esophagus (BE) who failed radiofrequency ablation (RFA).
results_summary: Cryotherapy achieved CE-D in 72% of patients with persistent dysplasia and CE-IM in 50% of all RFA failures, with no reported adverse events. The CE-IM rate with cryotherapy (50%) was lower than RFA's 78% in treatment-naïve patients.
population_specificity: Patients with dysplastic or non-dysplastic Barrett's esophagus who failed RFA, predominantly male with long-segment BE (median length 8 cm).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of inflammation in keloids and hypertrophic scars and evaluate treatment modalities, including cryotherapy, that reduce inflammation.
results_summary: The study suggests that cryotherapy, among other treatments, acts by reducing inflammation in keloids and hypertrophic scars, which are characterized by chronic reticular dermis inflammation. However, specific efficacy data for cryotherapy alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with keloids and hypertrophic scars caused by various cutaneous injuries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to outline treatment options for porokeratosis, including the role of cryotherapy in areas where topical agents are difficult or contraindicated.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy may be preferred for treating porokeratosis in areas where topical treatments are challenging or contraindicated, though no specific efficacy data or adverse events were detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with porokeratosis (specific subtypes not detailed for cryotherapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare traditional therapeutic options, including cryotherapy, for treating verrucae and evaluate their effectiveness and recurrence rates.
results_summary: The study found that traditional therapies like cryotherapy are somewhat effective but often lead to high recurrence rates or scarring. Laser therapy was highlighted as an alternative with deeper penetration and lower risk of pigmentation changes.
population_specificity: Children and young adults, with peak incidence during teenage years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze trends in vitreoretinal procedures, including Cryotherapy, to understand changes in standard care practices.
results_summary: Cryotherapy procedures declined across all indications, suggesting reduced clinical use or preference for alternative treatments. No specific efficacy or safety outcomes for Cryotherapy were reported.
population_specificity: US Medicare Part B Fee-for-Service beneficiaries and their providers (2000–2014).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prevalence, causes, and management of lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) and bladder overactivity following prostate cancer treatments, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to provide effective cancer treatment with lower risks of urinary incontinence compared to radical prostatectomy and radiotherapy, though it has fewer published studies and shorter follow-up.
population_specificity: Patients treated for localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy with other treatment modalities for digital mucous cysts (DMC) and provide a practical management algorithm.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was identified as a second-line treatment for DMC, with a cure rate of 72%, which was lower than surgery (95%) but higher than corticosteroid injections (61%) and expression of cyst content (39%).
population_specificity: Patients with digital mucous cysts (DMC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy in managing small renal tumors, particularly in patients with comorbidities or contraindications to surgery.
results_summary: Cryotherapy demonstrated high efficacy (>90%) with a low complication rate (<10%), offering similar oncologic outcomes to surgery while sparing renal function, especially in patients with pre-existing chronic kidney disease.
population_specificity: Elderly patients with small renal tumors, multiple comorbidities, contraindications to surgery, hereditary renal cancer, bilateral renal tumors, solitary kidney, or chronic kidney disease.
study_duration: Follow-up continued up to 10 years after ablation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of the Vascular Impulse Technology (VIT) system versus elevation in reducing posttraumatic swelling in patients with upper and lower extremity fractures.
results_summary: The study is a prospective, randomized controlled trial designed to evaluate the VIT system's ability to reduce swelling and shorten the time to surgery for fractures, but results are not yet provided in the abstract.
population_specificity: 280 patients with fractures of the upper and lower extremities, including nine different injury types.
effective_dosage: Not specified (intermittent pneumatic compression applied via the VIT system).
study_duration: Not specified (time until swelling resolves sufficiently for surgery).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide guidance for risk stratification and treatment choice, including cryotherapy, for non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) patients.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the treatment modalities for low-risk NMSCs, alongside other methods, but does not provide specific results or comparisons for cryotherapy alone. High-risk NMSCs require more aggressive treatments, potentially including adjuvant therapies.
population_specificity: Fair-skinned populations with non-melanoma skin cancers (basal cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the use of cryotherapy for prostate cancer as part of a multidisciplinary approach to urologic disorders.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as part of refined image-guided techniques for prostate cancer, but specific outcomes or effects of cryotherapy are not detailed. Encouraging results from early studies using targeted gene expression panels are cited, but these are not directly tied to cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with urologic disorders, specifically prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of 2-hour versus 6-hour cryotherapy in reducing severe mucositis and explore factors influencing melphalan pharmacokinetics and outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that 2-hour cryotherapy was at least as effective as 6-hour cryotherapy in reducing severe mucositis. Pharmacokinetic variability was linked to fat-free mass, hematocrit, creatinine clearance, and the rs4240803 SLC7A5 polymorphism, but melphalan exposure did not correlate with survival outcomes.
population_specificity: Eligible patients with multiple myeloma undergoing autologous stem cell transplantation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of cold-water immersion (CWI) and whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) on post-exercise thermoregulatory and blood flow responses in the lower limbs.
results_summary: CWI resulted in greater reductions in thigh skin, superficial, and deep muscle temperatures, as well as greater decreases in femoral artery conductance and cutaneous vasoconstriction compared to WBC. Rectal temperature reductions were similar between both interventions.
population_specificity: Ten healthy males.
effective_dosage: CWI (8°C for 10 min), WBC (-110°C for 2 min).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the estimates and definitions of HPV persistence in women following Cryotherapy treatment for cervical intra-epithelial neoplasia (CIN).
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a higher HPV persistence rate compared to loop excision and conization, with persistence declining over time (27% at 3 months to 10% at 24 months). The study noted variability in persistence estimates influenced by factors like treatment method and follow-up duration.
population_specificity: Women treated for cervical intra-epithelial neoplasia (CIN).
study_duration: Follow-up ranged from 1.5 to 80 months after treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of immunotherapy and cryotherapy in treating wart lesions caused by human papillomavirus.
results_summary: Cryotherapy resulted in complete remission in 56.7% of patients, requiring more sessions (3.82 ± 2.481) compared to immunotherapy. No statistically significant difference in session count was found between the two treatments.
population_specificity: 60 patients with verruca vulgaris and plantar warts.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy with liquid nitrogen for a maximum of ten sessions or until lesion clearance.
study_duration: Until complete clearance or up to ten sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the appropriate treatment for plantar and common warts and predict patient responses to cryotherapy and immunotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy had a prediction accuracy of 80.7% for treatment response, suggesting it is an effective method for wart treatment. The expert system helped improve treatment selection and outcomes.
population_specificity: 180 patients with plantar and common warts from a dermatology clinic in Mashhad, Iran.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the efficacy and safety of superficial cryotherapy for treating alopecia areata (AA) of the eyebrow.
results_summary: Superficial cryotherapy significantly increased hair density and thickness in treated eyebrows compared to untreated controls, with minimal to no adverse events reported. The treatment showed high compliance and relatively good efficacy.
population_specificity: 20 patients with AA of the eyebrow, previously treated with DPCP immunotherapy on the scalp.
effective_dosage: Superficial cryotherapy performed every other week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review evidence on combining physical activity and cryotherapy to optimize symptomatic treatment in rheumatoid arthritis patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with physical activity improved disease activity and pain relief, though details on physical activity interventions and aerobic capacity were lacking. Aerobic and high-intensity multiactivity exercises were most effective for improving aerobic capacity.
population_specificity: Rheumatoid arthritis patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare postprocedure pain in pancreatic carcinoma patients treated with irreversible electroporation (IRE) and cryoablation (CRYO).
results_summary: The study compared pain levels using a numerical rating scale (VAS) and 24-hour hydromorphone use between IRE and CRYO groups, both under celiac plexus block (CPB). Other parameters like complications and ECOG performance status were noted, but specific results for cryotherapy were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with pancreatic carcinoma (26 patients with 27 lesions treated with cryosurgery).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy, photobiomodulation therapy (PBMT), and their combination in muscle recovery after fatigue-inducing exercise.
results_summary: Cryotherapy alone showed less efficacy in improving muscle recovery compared to PBMT or combined treatments, as evidenced by lower MVC capacity and higher oxidative damage markers. Combining cryotherapy with PBMT reduced PBMT's efficacy.
population_specificity: 40 volunteers divided into five groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the recurrence rates of keratocystic odontogenic tumors (KCOTs) treated with various surgical methods, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that enucleation + cryotherapy had a recurrence rate of 20.9%, which was not statistically significantly different from enucleation alone (RR 0.88, P = 0.56). Cryotherapy was less effective than enucleation + Carnoy's solution (5.3% recurrence) but more effective than marsupialization (28.7% recurrence).
population_specificity: Patients with keratocystic odontogenic tumors (KCOTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the efficacy, patient selection, and toxicities of salvage cryotherapy for locally recurrent prostate cancer after primary radiotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, among other salvage options, shows comparable efficacy with biochemical-recurrence-free survival rates around 50% at 5 years, though it is more toxic than primary treatments. Toxicity profiles differ among salvage modalities, but all are more toxic than initial treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with locally recurrent prostate cancer after primary radiotherapy and sufficient life expectancy, without metastatic disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the importance of individual characteristics and different therapy modalities, including Cryotherapy, in the recurrence of plantar warts.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results for Cryotherapy, focusing instead on pulsed dye laser (PDL) and CO₂ laser treatments. PDL showed the lowest recurrence rate, while smoking increased relapse risk.
population_specificity: 199 patients affected by multiple plantar warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to verify the effectiveness of cryotherapy in relieving perineal pain in women after vaginal delivery with episiotomy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced pain in the experimental group compared to the control group immediately after treatment and one hour later. Lower perineal temperature correlated with reduced pain, and 88% of women reported satisfaction with the treatment.
population_specificity: 50 women experiencing postpartum pain after vaginal delivery with episiotomy.
effective_dosage: Application of a crushed ice bag for 20 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of intracanal cryotherapy with negative pressure irrigation (EndoVac) on postendodontic pain after vital single-visit root canal treatment.
results_summary: The study found that intracanal cryotherapy eliminated postendodontic pain across all monitoring periods, while negative pressure irrigation reduced pain after 6 hours. Pain levels in control and room-temperature saline groups were initially high but diminished after one week.
population_specificity: 75 single-rooted teeth with single root canals in patients undergoing vital single-visit root canal treatment.
effective_dosage: 20 mL of 2 to 4°C cold saline irrigated for 5 minutes using EndoVac.
study_duration: 5 minutes of irrigation during the procedure, with pain assessed up to 7 days post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically discuss key steps of focal therapy (FT) for low to intermediate risk localized prostate cancer and analyze available energy modalities, including their advantages and unmet needs.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that FT may offer a promising treatment option for prostate cancer but identifies challenges such as patient selection, treatment planning, and post-therapy monitoring that need addressing before routine clinical implementation.
population_specificity: Low to intermediate risk localized prostate cancer patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the recurrence rate (RR) of keratocystic odontogenic tumors (KOTs) treated with cryotherapy compared to other surgical methods.
results_summary: Enucleation plus liquid nitrogen cryotherapy had a weighted recurrence rate of 14.5%, making it one of the more effective treatments, though resection (8.4%) and enucleation with Carnoy's solution (11.5%) performed slightly better. Cryotherapy was recommended as a first-line treatment for primary KOTs due to its low recurrence rate.
population_specificity: Patients with non-syndromic keratocystic odontogenic tumors (KOTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a nonpharmacologic, opioid-sparing treatment for trauma pain.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, along with other nonpharmacologic treatments, can supplement pharmacologic analgesics and is safe and easy to implement in multimodal pain management.
population_specificity: Trauma patients requiring pain management.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether supervised physiotherapy, including cryotherapy as part of usual care, improved recovery outcomes for simple grade 1 and 2 ankle sprains compared to usual care alone.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in excellent recovery rates between the physiotherapy group (which included cryotherapy) and the usual care group (which also included cryotherapy) at three months. By six months, the trend slightly favored usual care, but differences were neither statistically nor clinically significant.
population_specificity: Patients aged ≥16 with simple grade 1 or 2 ankle sprains, recruited from acute care settings in Kingston, ON, Canada.
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryotherapy was part of "usual care" instructions).
study_duration: Follow-up lasted six months, but the exact duration of cryotherapy use was not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the influence of cryotherapy with a crushed-ice pack on shoulder proprioception, including joint position sense, force sense, threshold for detecting passive movement, and maximal force production.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced maximal voluntary isometric contraction (~10% reduction) and impaired shoulder position sense and threshold for detecting passive movement, but no significant differences were found in force sense at 20% and 50% of maximal force reproduction.
population_specificity: 48 healthy women aged 22.6 ± 0.4 years with a mean BMI of 22.8 ± 0.37 kg/m² and body fat percentage of 15.4 ± 1.5%.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a continuous cold flow device was superior to traditional ice packs in reducing pain, edema, and blood loss after total knee arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant differences between the continuous cold flow device and traditional ice packs in reducing pain, edema, or blood loss. A modest reduction in knee volume was noted after 7 days, but no other meaningful benefits were observed.
population_specificity: 50 patients who underwent primary total knee arthroplasty.
effective_dosage: Continuous cold flow device (Hilotherm) vs. crushed ice packs; frequency not specified.
study_duration: Evaluated at postoperative first, third, and seventh days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of two local cryotherapy techniques (ice and cold CO₂) on synovial power Doppler activity and pain in non-septic knee arthritis.
results_summary: The study found a significant reduction in power Doppler scores the day after treatment in cryotherapy-treated knees compared to non-treated knees, with both ice and cold CO₂ showing effectiveness.
population_specificity: 30 patients with non-septic knee arthritis.
effective_dosage: Ice: 30 minutes; cold CO₂: dosage not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical outcomes of focal therapy (including cryotherapy) as a definitive treatment for primary prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that focal therapy outcomes for prostate cancer were similar to whole gland therapy but with fewer side effects, based on data from 2288 patients treated with seven different modalities.
population_specificity: Adult male patients with primary prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify clinical factors affecting the adequacy of the transformation zone (TZ) in cervical smears, including the impact of previous cryotherapy.
results_summary: Previous cryotherapy was associated with inadequacy of TZ in cervical smears. The study found that factors like STD history and hormonal usage also contributed to TZ inadequacy.
population_specificity: Women undergoing Pap smears at Thammasat University Hospital, Thailand (n=2,098).
study_duration: Data collected over one year (January to December 2015).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate focal therapy, including cryotherapy, as a treatment option for low-risk and intermediate-risk prostate cancer, comparing its potential benefits and limitations to traditional whole-gland therapies.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that focal therapies like cryotherapy may reduce morbidity compared to whole-gland treatments, but long-term oncological data are lacking, preventing formal recommendations. Controversy remains regarding patient selection and tumor localization strategies.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with low-risk and intermediate-risk prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent developments in cryotherapy's role in treating advanced renal cell carcinoma, particularly for patients with significant comorbidities.
results_summary: The study found that cryoablation may offer local cancer control and avoid surgical complications in patients with small renal lesions and significant comorbidities, though it did not provide specific efficacy data.
population_specificity: Patients with small renal lesions and significant comorbidities, as well as those with metastatic renal cell carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of MRI-guided focal therapy, including Cryotherapy, as a middle-ground treatment for low- to intermediate-grade prostate cancer.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that focal therapy, including Cryotherapy, offers a potential alternative to radical treatments but highlights concerns about overtreatment in low-grade cases and undertreatment in multifocal disease. Further research is deemed necessary.
population_specificity: Men with low- to intermediate-grade prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy in treating renal cancer and managing retroperitoneal fat accumulation in a patient with FPLD2.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used to treat one renal cancer in a patient with FPLD2, alongside a contralateral nephrectomy and debulking of retroperitoneal fat. The intervention, combined with Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, successfully controlled the disease for 3 years.
population_specificity: A single patient with familial partial lipodystrophy type 2 (FPLD2) and bilateral renal cancers.
study_duration: Not specified for cryotherapy alone; overall follow-up was 3 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the best anesthesia and analgesia methods, including cryotherapy, for outpatient ACL reconstruction to manage postoperative pain and facilitate timely discharge.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was recommended as part of multimodal analgesia, alongside peri-articular LIA, NSAIDs, and corticosteroids, but its standalone efficacy was not specifically detailed. No adverse effects of cryotherapy were reported.
population_specificity: Patients above 15 years of age undergoing outpatient ACL reconstruction (69% male, 31% female, average age 30 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the efficacy of cryotherapy (whole body and local) in treating restless legs syndrome (RLS) symptoms compared to conventional drug treatments.
results_summary: Whole body cryotherapy at -60°C significantly improved RLS symptoms and quality of life, while local cryotherapy showed benefits in quality of life and sleep quality but not in primary RLS symptoms. The -10°C group only reduced wake phases per night, with no serious side effects reported.
population_specificity: 35 patients (28 women, mean age 60.9±12.5 years) with idiopathic RLS and symptoms starting by 6pm.
effective_dosage: Three minutes daily at 6pm (whole body at -60°C or -10°C, local at -17°C).
study_duration: Two weeks of intervention after a two-week baseline, followed by a four-week observation period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and hemodynamic complications associated with spray cryotherapy (SCT) for treating obstructive airway tumors.
results_summary: The study found that SCT effectively palliated respiratory symptoms but was associated with severe hemodynamic complications, including hypotension, bradycardia, and fatalities in some cases. The authors proposed pulmonary venous gaseous emboli as a likely cause for these complications.
population_specificity: 28 patients (median age 60 years) with obstructive airway tumors, including primary lung cancers, pulmonary metastases, and benign lesions.
study_duration: Median procedure length was 78 minutes (range, 15-176 minutes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of cryotherapy and other percutaneous ablation techniques for less-invasive breast cancer treatment.
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryotherapy has promising potential for breast cancer treatment but highlights the need for larger multicenter trials to confirm efficacy compared to lumpectomy. Unanswered questions remain regarding patient selection and axilla management.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients (specific details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether HD-OCT could serve as an objective diagnostic tool to measure therapeutic outcomes of cryotherapy and intralesional steroid injections for pathological scars.
results_summary: HD-OCT and sonography showed reduced epidermal and dermal thickness and scar height/depth after cryotherapy and triamcinolone acetonide injections, correlating with treatment success. Subjective and objective evaluation methods also showed positive correlation.
population_specificity: Eight patients with pathological scars.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate surgical treatment outcomes for metastatic gastric cancer and review current concepts in advanced surgical management, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as a local management option for advanced gastric cancer but does not provide specific results regarding its effectiveness. The role of metastasectomy and other treatments remains debatable, with prolonged survival achieved only under specific circumstances.
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic gastric cancer, particularly those with hepatic, peritoneal, or lung metastases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of whole-body and partial-body cryotherapy on skin temperature and classify exposure protocols based on desired outcomes.
results_summary: The study highlighted a lack of standardized protocols for cryotherapy, including temperature, duration, and repetitions, and noted heterogeneity in reported exposure methods. It emphasized insufficient data on actual cabin temperatures during treatment.
population_specificity: Humans in the context of medicine, health, and sports.
effective_dosage: Exposure to very cold air (≤ -110°C) for 1-4 minutes.
study_duration: Not specified beyond single exposure durations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop national clinical practice guidelines for screening and treating precancerous cervical lesions, including evaluating the effectiveness of cryotherapy compared to other treatments.
